awd_titl_txt: Dissertation Research:  Biomechanics of the Hominoid        Masticatory Apparatus
awd_abstract_narration: ABSTRACT    P.I. Andrew Hill/ Xingbin Chen  SBR-9316717    This project involves an application of a high-level engineering method, Finite Element Method, to an investigation of the biomechanical and material properties of the chewing system in humans and apes.  This system is extremely complex, yet this non-destructive technique has all the potential to shed light on the mechanical adaptations of the mandible, and also the factors that may have shaped its morphological changes during the course of our recent evolution.    The graduate student is already very well trained in both engineering and anthropology, and will become a leading researcher in this area as a result of this support.  The work may well have clinical implications in dentistry at some future date.  ***  P\anthro\jfried\9316717.abs                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         !         !         !
